props.active: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component
props.activeClass: The class applied to the component when it is in an active state
props.appendIcon: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot
props.activeColor: The applied color when the component is in an active state
props.appendAvatar: Appends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component after default content in the **append** slot
props.hideNoData: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.
props.prependAvatar: Prepends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content
props.menu: Renders with the menu open by default
props.bgColor: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)
props.clearable: Allows for the component to be cleared
props.color: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)
props.contentClass: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component
props.disabled: Removes the ability to click or target the component
props.density: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.
props.eager: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.
props.height: Sets the height for the component
props.icon: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.
props.items: An array of strings or objects used for automatically generating children components
props.label: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component
props.mandatory: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).
props.link: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the href or to prop.
props.name: Sets the component's name attribute.
props.start: Applies margin at the end of the component.
props.counter: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.
props.persistentCounter: Forces counter to always be visible
props.end: Applies margin at the start of the component.
props.noDataText: Text shown when no items are provided to the component
props.modelValue: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array
props.persistent: Clicking outside or pressing **esc** key will not dismiss the dialog
props.prependIcon: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content
props.selectedClass: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.
props.size: Sets the height and width of the component.
props.symbol: The [Symbol](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol) used to hook into group functionality for components like [v-btn-toggle](/components/btn-toggle) and [v-bottom-navigation](/components/bottom-navigations/)
props.messages: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string
props.tag: Specify a custom tag used on the root element
props.textColor: Applies a specified color to the control text - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)
props.text: Specify content text for the component.
props.search: Text input used to filter items.
props.title: Specify a title text for the component.
props.subtitle: Specify a subtitle text for the component.
props.valueComparator: Apply a custom comparison algorithm used for values
props.variant: Applies a distinct style to the component
props.width: Sets the width for the component
props.mode: Sets the transition mode (does not apply to transition-group). You can find more information on the Vue documentation [for transition modes](https://vuejs.org/v2/api/#transition).
props.origin: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).
props.hideOnLeave: Hides the leaving element (no exit animation)
props.leaveAbsolute: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/))

slots.activator: When used, will activate the component when clicked (or hover for specific components). This manually stops the event propagation. Without this slot, if you open the component through its model, you will need to manually stop the event propagation
slots.append: Adds an item inside the input and after input content
slots.appendInner: Adds an item inside the input content
slots.chip: Slot for custom chip when using the [chip](#property-chip) prop
slots.details: Slot for custom input details to modifying the display of [messages](#props-messages).
slots.label: The default slot of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component
slots.loader: Slot for custom loader (displayed when [loading](#props-loading) prop is equal to true)
slots.prepend: Adds an item outside the input and before input content
slots.prependInner: Adds an item inside the input content
slots.progress: Slot for custom progress linear (displayed when **loading** prop is not equal to Boolean False)
slots.text: Slot for the component's text content
slots.title: Slot for the component's title content
slots.no-data: Defines content for when no items are provided
slots.subtitle: Slot for the component's subtitle content
slots.append-item: Adds an item after menu content
slots.prepend-item: Adds an item before menu content

events.click: Event that is emitted when the component is clicked
events.click:close: Emitted when close icon is clicked
events.click:append: Emitted when appended icon is clicked
events.click:appendInner: Emitted when appended inner icon is clicked
events.click:prepend: Emitted when prepended icon is clicked
events.click:prependInner: Emitted when prepended inner icon is clicked
events.click:clear: Emitted when clear icon is clicked
events.update:search: Event emitted when the search value changes
events.update:focused: Event that is emitted when the component's focus state changes
events.update:menu: Event that is emitted when the component's menu state changes
events.update:modelValue: Event that is emitted when the component's model changes
events.group:selected: Event that is emitted when an item is selected within a group.

exposed.filteredItems: The current array of items based upon the current search text.
exposed.isFocused: Returns true if the input is focused.
exposed.isPristine: Returns true if the input has not been modified in any way.
exposed.menu: Returns true if the menu is currently open.
exposed.select: The function used to select an items. The first argument expects the value of the item.
